bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Carlton W. Werkau served as the Secretary-Treasurer for the Communications Workers of America (CWA) from 1943 until his death in 1955.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of photographs, both personal and union related, correspondence, and CWA records. The CWA records consist of Convention proceedings from 1953-1955 as well as a strike manual and tax files. Articles and letters concerning Werkau's death in 1955 are also included.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Carlton W. Werkau Papers; WAG 309; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: John L. Quinn, Communications Workers of America District Council, sent a gift of Carlton W. Werkau photographs, correspondence, and personal documents in 2010. The accession number associated with this gift is 2010.011.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library does not have information about who owns copyright to this collection. Materials in this collection are expected to enter the public domain in 2075. The Tamiment Library is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.

custodhist.head: Custodial History note
custodhist.p: A relative of Carlton W. Werkau sent these papers to the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) Regional Office in Winston-Salem, NC. The collection was later transferred from the NLRB to The Communications Workers of America (CWA), where Werkau had served as Secretary-Treasurer from 1943-1955.
